text: [Music]
uh I think Lincoln people are fascinated
with Lincoln because he does seem to
exemplify so many different aspects of
what we think of as the sort of
quintessential American Experience uh of
course there are a lot of different
linol out there and you can decide for
yourself which one you want to adopt
there is the great emancipator the man
who freed the slaves who is the example
of using political power for
indisputably moral just
ends there is uh in sort of equal and
opposite reaction there is Lincoln the
racist who really shared the uh uh
racial views of his time and uh ought
not to be seen as the great emancipator
there are people who hold that there is
Lincoln the man who went from Rags to
Riches or Log Cabin to White House who
who for many people exemplifies the
promise of social mobility and
opportunity in American history there's
honest Abe the politician who didn't
didn't deceive the people and uh uh you
know and and really was not like uh
sometimes we think of many politicians
as scheming and manipulative on the
other hand there are those who see
Lincoln as someone who did uh manipulate
the country into Civil War who became a
dictator this is generally a southern
point of view trampled on the
constitution in other words no matter
what your point of view you can find
Lincoln out there if you look hard
enough and so he seems to be uh uh
somehow a a lightning rod for people to
to uh you know depending on what their
view of American History
is well I think that the issues that
confronted American Life American
society in the mid 19th century are
still with us so Lincoln is all
contemporary in that he was grappling
with questions that are right on our
agenda today issues like well race in
American society what is the status of
African-Americans can we achieve genuine
Racial equality in this country that was
a question of Lincoln's time also
relations between the federal government
and the states obviously still an
important issue the constitution in
Wartime obviously lately a big big issue
Lincoln suspended the rid of habius
Corpus he set up military tribunals um
what happens to constitutional rights in
the middle of a war so Lincoln grappled
with that we're still trying to figure
that out well over 100 years later so
Lincoln seems more relevant to us than
many other figures of the 19th century I
don't think you would say Henry Clay was
our contemporary or Martin vanan was our
contemporary or Andrew Johnson or you
know many other figures of that period
but somehow Lincoln seems to be speaking
to issues that are still on our minds
today
